AttributeReference.description: Relative endpoint address on which the ESB Bus listens to the incoming request, for example “/FSN/payment”

AttributeReference.ErrorMessage: Enter a valid URL. E.g. /wsdl/sample.wsdl; wsdl/sample.wsdl
AttributeReference.description: URL to the WSDL defining the WS provider endpoint.URL format: wsdl/<InterfaceName>.wsdl, where the WSDL is available in src.main.resources.wsdl
Used for reliable one-way message exchanges.The consumer sends a message to a provider, which returns a status.When the processing fails a fault is returned.

Name of the selected service contained in the referenced WSDL
Name of the selected port of a selected service (that you provide in the Service Name field) contained in the referenced WSDL

Standard: Message is executed with standard processing mechanism.Robust: Provider invokes service synchronously and the processing errors are returned to the consumer.Automatic Redelivery: If message delivery fails, the message is persisted and the ESB Bus automatically tries to deliver the message again.
Verify the data integrity of the incoming request message and check the sender's identity.
Sign the outgoing response message to ensure data integrity
Include X.509 certificate in the response message
Alias of the private key that is used to sign the message

Enable this WS endpoint to:Accept the compressed request messagesCompress the response messages if the WS Consumer can handle them
Encrypt the message that is persisted in a reliable messaging protocol

Default value is “0”; this restricts the deferred sending of acknowledgments in case the stream of incoming messages is steady,i.e. the number of messages for one destination per minute stays above the specified threshold (only effective if the AcknowledgmentInterval is greater than 0). If the value is "0", an acknowledgment is sent for each message immediately. The "0" value must be used, if the sender system is an ABAP system.
Specify the duration (in ms) after which the sender endpoint transmits an acknowledgment

AttributeReference.ErrorMessage: Enter a valid positive number, 0 means no alert will be raised
AttributeReference.description: If the number of attempts to receive a message from the CXF bus exceeds the retry threshold, an alert is raised. Default value '0' indicates that alert is not raised on error.
Verify the data integrity of the incoming request message and check the sender's identity
